comment: The object of Choice can only be something that is within one's reach. Changing the past is beyond even a god's power.
quote_eng: For only this is deprived even from a god, to make undone that has been done.

comment: Became a maxim about wartime emergency measures. In its original context, Cicero advocates for armed self-defence.
quote_eng: For the laws are silent among arms.

comment: One of the most famous lines attributed to the pre-Socratic philosopher. Encapsulates his view of a Cosmos that is in constant flux.
quote_eng: Everything flows and nothing stands still.
quote_orig: Î Î¬Î½Ï„Î± Ï‡Ï‰ÏÎµá¿– ÎºÎ±á½¶ Î¿á½Î´á½²Î½ Î¼Î­Î½ÎµÎ¹.

comment: One of the cardinal mistakes a poet can commit.
quote_eng: I strive to be brief, I become obscure.

comment: External factors are temporal, internal perception is subjective. Keeping these in mind helps to achieve peace in one's soul
quote_eng: The universe is change, life is assumption.
quote_orig: á½‰ ÎºÏŒÏƒÎ¼Î¿Ï‚ á¼€Î»Î»Î¿Î¯Ï‰ÏƒÎ¹Ï‚, á½ Î²Î¯Î¿Ï‚ á½‘Ï€ÏŒÎ»Î·ÏˆÎ¹Ï‚.

comment: The transience of life frequently appears as an incentive to act in the Meditations
quote_eng: Fate hangs above: while you live, while it is possible, become good!

comment: Expresses the need to be proper and righteous solely by inner volition.
quote_eng: Therefore, one should be straight, not straightened.
quote_orig: á½ˆÏÎ¸á½¸Î½ Î¿á½–Î½ Îµá¼¶Î½Î±Î¹ Ï‡ÏÎ®, Î¿á½Ï‡á½¶ á½€ÏÎ¸Î¿ÏÎ¼ÎµÎ½Î¿Î½.

comment: A poet character's explanation for his poor clothing.
quote_eng: The love of creativity has never made anyone rich.
quote_orig: Amor ingenii neminem unquam divitem fecit.

comment: Famous paraphrase of Socrates' views on the limits of knowledge.
quote_eng: He himself knows only one thing that he knows nothing.
quote_orig: Ipse se nihil scire id unum sciat.

attrib_to: Attributed to Socrates by Diogenes Laertius
comment: Socrates seeing the multitude of wares in the market.
quote_eng: How many thing I don't have the need for!
